metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10921 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The grant-table feature in Xen through 4.8.x does not ensure sufficienttype counts for a GNTMAP_device_map and GNTMAP_host_map mapping, whichallows guest OS users to cause a denial of service (count mismanagement andmemory corruption) or obtain privileged host OS access, aka XSA-224 bug 2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10921` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.12
No subscription required
